entry.title: Þróun (Development) • Re: Auroracoin API
entry.content:
Insight API for Auroracoin will shortly be running at:

insight.auroracoin.io

I would like to offer a version in Icelandic. Is anyone willing to undertake a small translation job?

This file: https://github.com/bitpay/insight/blob/master/po/es.po

Replace the Spanish words with Icelandic.

Name your price in AUR.

Statistics: Posted by Bimmerhead — 12 Feb 2015 20:31

entry.title: Þróun (Development) • an alias system for bitcoin... and Auroracoin
entry.content:
One of the inconveniences of cryptocurrency is the long string of numbers and letters that constitute addresses.

What I didn't realize until yesterday is that a system already exists to allow aliasing of these addresses to something human-memorable, without trusting a centralized authority.

Namecoin ID
https://forum.namecoin.info/viewforum.php?f=23
https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=84653.0

Strangely, I can't find a single altcoin wallet that has implemented this.
Instead, we have openalias.org and onename.io

Seems like this would be something to consider for a future release of Auroracoin.

Statistics: Posted by Bimmerhead — 10 Feb 2015 17:18

entry.title: Verðlaun (Bounties) • Re: iPhone wallet
entry.content:
I've been thinking about this idea of an altcoin co-operative again, where the developers from many small, floundering coins work together.

Can someone who has the technical knowledge articulate for me what the benefits of co-operation would be to an individual developer?

Can we say that it would cut down their development time for wallets, tipbots, merchant tools etc. by X%

Would the coins all need to be similar? For instance, to make this work should they all be scrypt mining coins? Have a standard feature-set?
